simplified_definition: a flat, even fold that is sewn or pressed in cloth.

definition: "imp.  p. p. of Plead"
simplified_definition: a past tense and past participle of "plead."

definition: "A person who undertook  or became responsible for another; a bail; a surety; a hostage."
simplified_definition: a serious promise; vow.

definition: "Containing plenty; copious; abundant; ample; as  a plentiful harvest; a plentiful supply of water."
simplified_definition: large in amount; more than enough.

definition: "Full or adequate supply; enough and to spare; sufficiency; specifically  abundant productiveness of the earth; ample supply for human wants; abundance; copiousness."
simplified_definition: a full amount or supply.

definition: "One of the Plesiosauria."
simplified_definition: an extinct marine reptile with limbs like paddles, a large flattened body, and a short tail. The plesiosaur lived millions of years ago.

definition: "A kind of small pinchers with long jaws   used for bending or cutting metal rods or wire for handling small objects such as the parts of a watch etc."
simplified_definition: a tool that has a pair of jaws connected to handles and is used for holding, bending, or cutting things.

definition: "To walk on slowly or heavily."
simplified_definition: to move in a slow, tired, or heavy way.

definition: "Contrivance; deep reach of thought; ability to plot or intrigue."

definition: "Any grallatorial bird allied to  or resembling the true plovers as the crab plover ; the American upland plover ; and other species of sandpipers."
simplified_definition: a bird with a rounded body, a short tail, and a short bill. Plovers run along the sea shore in short starts and stops, looking for food. The killdeer is one of the many different kinds of plovers.

definition: "Alt. of Plough"
simplified_definition: a heavy farm tool that has a wide blade and is pulled by a tractor or strong animal. Plows are used for turning over and cutting through soil.

definition: "To strip of  or as of feathers; as to pluck a fowl."

simplified_definition: an object made of cork, rubber, or other material used to block an opening.

simplified_definition: a type of fruit that has smooth red, purple, green, or yellow skin. It has sweet, soft flesh and a small, smooth pit inside. Plums grow on trees.

definition: "The entire clothing of a bird."
simplified_definition: the feathers of a bird.

definition: "To supply  as a building with a system of plumbing."
simplified_definition: a small weight tied to a line. A plumb is used to measure the depth of water or to test if something is straight up and down.

definition: "One who works in lead; esp.  one who furnishes fits and repairs lead iron or glass pipes and other apparatus for the conveyance of water gas or drainage in buildings."

simplified_definition: the system of pipes in a building that brings water in and removes water and waste.

simplified_definition: a large, fluffy, colorful feather.

definition: "To grow plump; to swell out; as  her cheeks have plumped."
simplified_definition: full and round in shape; chubby.

definition: "To take the goods of by force  or without right; to pillage; to spoil; to sack; to strip; to rob; as to plunder travelers."

definition: "The plural number; that form of a word which expresses or denotes more than one; a word in the plural form."
simplified_definition: having to do with or naming the form of a word that signals more than one.

definition: "More  required to be added; positive as distinguished from negative;  opposed to minus."
simplified_definition: added to; made greater by adding.

simplified_definition: a type of cloth having long, soft, thick fibers.

definition: "The son of Saturn and Rhea  brother of Jupiter and Neptune; the dark and gloomy god of the Lower World."
simplified_definition: the god of wealth and of the underworld in Greek mythology.

definition: "Inflammation of the lungs."

definition: "To cook  as eggs by breaking them into boiling water; also to cook with butter after breaking in a vessel."

definition: "One of several bags attached to a billiard table  into which the balls are driven."

definition: "A small book or case for carrying papers  money etc. in the pocket; also a notebook for the pocket."

definition: "A knife with one or more blades  which fold into the handle so as to admit of being carried in the pocket."
simplified_definition: a small knife with a blade or blades that fold into the handle.

definition: "A bag; a pouch."
simplified_definition: a long, thin, firm pouch that contains the seeds of a pea or bean plant.

definition: "A metrical composition; a composition in verse written in certain measures  whether in blank verse or in rhyme and characterized by imagination and poetic diction;  contradistinguished from prose; as the poems of Homer or of Milton."
simplified_definition: a piece of writing, often with words that rhyme and have a particular rhythm. Poems usually have imaginative language that expresses strong feeling.

definition: "One skilled in making poetry; one who has a particular genius for metrical composition; the author of a poem; an imaginative thinker or writer."
simplified_definition: a person who writes poetry.

definition: "Alt. of Poetical"
simplified_definition: like poetry in style or character.

definition: "Imaginative language or composition  whether expressed rhythmically or in prose. Specifically: Metrical composition; verse; rhyme; poems collectively; as heroic poetry; dramatic poetry; lyric or Pindaric poetry."

definition: "Anything which tapers to a sharp  welldefined termination. Specifically: A small promontory or cape; a tract of land extending into the water beyond the common shore line."
simplified_definition: the sharp end of something.

definition: "Sharp; having a sharp point; as  a pointed rock."

simplified_definition: a device, such as a stick or laser, used to show points on a map or other display.

simplified_definition: a substance that can kill or seriously harm living beings if it is swallowed, breathed, or otherwise taken in.

definition: "Having the qualities or effects of poison; venomous; baneful; corrupting; noxious."

definition: "The polestar. See North star  under North."
simplified_definition: a bright star in the constellation Ursa Minor; North Star.

definition: "See Polarity  and Polar n."
simplified_definition: a person who was born in or is a citizen of Poland.

definition: "A small European carnivore of the Weasel family . Its scent glands secrete a substance of an exceedingly disagreeable odor. Called also fitchet  foulmart and European ferret."
simplified_definition: a small mammal with dark fur, a long body, and short legs. Polecats are a kind of weasel. They live in Europe, northern Africa, and North America. Domesticated polecats are called ferrets. In North America, a kind of wild polecat is also called a ferret.

definition: "A guide or director."
simplified_definition: a bright star in the constellation Ursa Minor; Polaris; North Star.

definition: "The organized body of civil officers in a city  town or district whose particular duties are the preservation of good order the prevention and detection of crime and the enforcement of the laws."
simplified_definition: a department of a town, city, or state government that has the power to enforce laws, investigate crimes, and keep order.

definition: "A member of a body of police; a constable."
simplified_definition: a man who is a member of a police force.

definition: "Civil polity."

definition: "Fig.: Refinement; elegance of manners."
simplified_definition: of or having to do with Poland, or its people or language.

definition: "Characterized by refinement  or a high degree of finish; as polite literature."
simplified_definition: showing good manners or being thoughtful of others; courteous.

simplified_definition: having to do with the study or practice of politics, politicians, or government.

definition: "One versed or experienced in the science of government; one devoted to politics; a statesman."
simplified_definition: a person involved in party politics.

definition: "The science of government; that part of ethics which has to do with the regulation and government of a nation or state  the preservation of its safety peace and prosperity the defense of its existence and rights against foreign control or conquest the augmentation of its strength and resources and the protection of its citizens in their rights with the preservation and improvement of their morals."

definition: "A dance of Polish origin  but now common everywhere. It is performed by two persons in common time."

definition: "Fine bran or flour."

definition: "To violate sexually; to debauch; to dishonor."

definition: "The act of polluting  or the state of being polluted ; defilement; uncleanness; impurity."
simplified_definition: an act or instance of polluting.

definition: "A similar game played on the ice  or on a prepared floor by players wearing skates."

definition: "A procession distinguished by ostentation and splendor; a pageant."
simplified_definition: a splendid display; magnificence.

definition: "Ostentatious; pretentious; boastful; vainlorious; as  pompous manners; a pompous style."
simplified_definition: showing an exaggerated sense of own's own importance.

definition: "A kind of cloak worn by the Spanish Americans  having the form of a blanket with a slit in the middle for the head to pass through. A kind of poncho made of rubber or painted cloth is used by the mounted troops in the United States service."
simplified_definition: a cloak that is like a blanket with a hole in the center for a person's head.

definition: "A body of water  naturally or artificially confined and usually of less extent than a lake."
simplified_definition: a small body of still water.

definition: "To weigh."
simplified_definition: to think about something deeply and carefully.

definition: "Twentyfive pounds sterling."

definition: "A breed of dogs having curly hair  and often showing remarkable intelligence in the performance of tricks."
simplified_definition: a breed of dog. Poodles range in size from very small to large and have thick, curly hair that can be cut in a fancy way.

definition: "To put together; to contribute to a common fund  on the basis of a mutual division of profits or losses; to make a common interest of; as the companies pooled their traffic."
simplified_definition: any small area of liquid that has collected on a surface; puddle; pond.

definition: "Destitute of property; wanting in material riches or goods; needy; indigent."
simplified_definition: without money, possessions, or other basic needs.

definition: "Any ecclesiastic  esp. a bishop."
simplified_definition: the head of the Roman Catholic Church.

definition: "The timber of the tulip tree;  called also white poplar."

definition: "Adapted to the means of the common people; possessed or obtainable by the many; hence  cheap; common; ordinary; inferior; as popular prices; popular amusements."

definition: "The quality or state of being popular; especially  the state of being esteemed by or of being in favor with the people at large; good will or favor proceeding from the people; as the popularity of a law statesman or a book."

definition: "Populous."
simplified_definition: to live in; inhabit.

definition: "of Populate"
simplified_definition: being inhabited by people.

definition: "The whole number of people  or inhabitants in a country or portion of a country; as a population of ten millions."
simplified_definition: the people who live in an area, considered as a group.

definition: "Abounding in people; full of inhabitants; containing many inhabitants in proportion to the extent of the country."
simplified_definition: having a large population.

definition: "Purslain."

definition: "A covered and inclosed entrance to a building  whether taken from the interior and forming a sort of vestibule within the main wall or projecting without and with a separate roof. Sometimes the porch is large enough to serve as a covered walk. See also Carriage porch under Carriage and Loggia."
simplified_definition: an open platform with a roof that serves as the back or front entrance of a house.

definition: "Any Old Word rodent of the genus Hystrix  having the back covered with long sharp erectile spines or quills sometimes a foot long. The common species of Europe and Asia  is the best known."
simplified_definition: a small mammal with bristles or spines in its fur. Porcupines are rodents closely related to guinea pigs, but much larger. Some porcupines have quills with barbs that hurt any animal that attacks them. Different kinds of porcupines live in North and South America, Europe, Africa, and Asia.

definition: "To look or gaze steadily in reading or studying; to fix the attention; to be absorbed;  often with on or upon  and now usually with over."
simplified_definition: to study or read carefully.

definition: "The flesh of swine  fresh or salted used for food."
simplified_definition: meat from a pig or hog.

definition: "Full of pores; having interstices in the skin or in the substance of the body; having spiracles or passages for fluids; permeable by liquids; as  a porous skin; porous wood."
simplified_definition: having many pores.

definition: "Any small cetacean of the genus Phocaena  especially P. communis or P. phocaena of Europe and the closely allied American species . The color is dusky or blackish above paler beneath. They are closely allied to the dolphins but have a shorter snout. Called also harbor porpoise herring hag puffing pig and snuffer."
simplified_definition: a mammal that lives in the ocean. Porpoises look like large fish, but they breathe air. Some kinds of porpoises have a triangular fin on their back. Porpoises are closely related to dolphins and other whales with teeth. Porpoises have a round head with a blunt snout.

definition: "A food made by boiling some leguminous or farinaceous substance  or the meal of it in water or in milk making of broth or thin pudding; as barley porridge milk porridge bean porridge etc."
simplified_definition: a food made of cereal grains such as oatmeal that are boiled in water or milk.

definition: "In law and commercial usage  a harbor where vessels are admitted to discharge and receive cargoes from whence they depart and where they finish their voyages."
simplified_definition: a place where ships load and unload, and its nearby town or city.

definition: "Capable of being borne or carried; easily transported; conveyed without difficulty; as  a portable bed desk engine."
simplified_definition: able to be carried or easily moved.

definition: "A malt liquor  of a dark color and moderately bitter taste possessing tonic and intoxicating qualities."
simplified_definition: a person whose job is to carry baggage at a train station, airport, or hotel.

definition: "An embrasure in a ship's side. See d Port."

definition: "In the theory of gravitation  or of other forces acting in space a function of the rectangular coordinates which determine the position of a point such that its differential coefficients with respect to the coordinates are equal to the components of the force at the point considered;  also called potential function or force function. It is called also Newtonian potential when the force is directed to a fixed center and is inversely as the square of the distance from the center."

simplified_definition: a reason in favor of something.

definition: "Yielding or bringing profit or gain; gainful; lucrative; useful; helpful; advantageous; beneficial; as  a profitable trade; profitable business; a profitable study or profession."

definition: "To cause to sink deeply; to cause to dive or penetrate far down."

definition: "To pour out; to give or spend liberally; to lavish; to squander."

definition: "Moving forward; proceeding onward; advancing; evincing progress; increasing; as  progressive motion or course;  opposed to retrograde."

definition: "To forbid by authority; to interdict; as  God prohibited Adam from eating of the fruit of a certain tree; we prohibit a person from doing a thing and also the doing of the thing; as the law prohibits men from stealing or it prohibits stealing."
simplified_definition: to not allow by law.

definition: "To cast forward or revolve in the mind; to contrive; to devise; to scheme; as  to project a plan."
simplified_definition: any activity that takes great effort or planning.

definition: "One who projects a scheme or design; hence  one who forms fanciful or chimerical schemes."

definition: "To put off to a distant time; to postpone."

definition: "A place for walking; a public walk."
simplified_definition: a leisurely walk, especially in a public place.

definition: "Standing out  or projecting beyond the line surface of something; jutting; protuberant; in high relief; as a prominent figure on a vase."
simplified_definition: easy to see or notice because of some difference.

definition: "of Promise"
simplified_definition: seeming likely to succeed or turn out well in the future.

definition: "A high point of land or rock projecting into the sea beyond the line of coast; a headland; a high cape."
simplified_definition: a high cliff that sticks out into a large body of water or that rises above an area of lower land.

definition: "To contribute to the growth  enlargement or prosperity of ; to forward; to further; to encourage; to advance; to excite; as to promote learning; to promote disorder; to promote a business venture."

definition: "A limit of time given for payment of an account for produce purchased  this limit varying with different goods. See Promptnote."
simplified_definition: done immediately and without pause.

simplified_definition: having the habit of; being likely to.

definition: "A sharp projection  as of an antler."
simplified_definition: a thin, sharply pointed part of a tool.

definition: "A word used instead of a noun or name  to avoid the repetition of it. The personal pronouns in English are I thou or you he she it we ye and they."
simplified_definition: a word that can take the place of a noun or noun phrase. In the sentence, "He gave it to someone," "he," "it," and "someone" are examples of pronouns.

definition: "A shell  used as a die. See Props."

definition: "The college of the Propaganda  instituted by Urban VIII.  to educate priests for missions in all parts of the world."

definition: "To drive forward; to urge or press onward by force; to move  or cause to move; as the wind or steam propels ships; balls are propelled by gunpowder."

definition: "Belonging to one; one's own; individual."
simplified_definition: correct for a certain purpose.

definition: "Individually; after one's own manner."

definition: "An acquired or artificial quality; that which is given by art  or bestowed by man; as the poem has the properties which constitute excellence."

definition: "The offer by a party of what he has in view as to an intended business transaction  which with acceptance constitutes a contract."

definition: "A statement in terms of a truth to be demonstrated  or of an operation to be performed."

definition: "The act driving forward or away; the act or process of propelling; as  steam propulsion."

definition: "To write or repeat in a dull  tedious or prosy way."
simplified_definition: writing or speech in its usual form of a series of sentences. Most language that is not poetry can be described as prose. Novels, short stories, essays, and letters are examples of writing done in prose.

definition: "To institute and carry on a legal prosecution; as  to prosecute for public offenses."
simplified_definition: to begin or carry on a court action against in order to enforce the law.

definition: "That which is hoped for; ground for hope or expectation; expectation; probable result; as  the prospect of success."

definition: "To be successful; to succeed; to be fortunate or prosperous; to thrive; to make gain."
simplified_definition: to be successful or have good luck; thrive.

simplified_definition: the state of being wealthy and successful.

definition: "Tending to prosperity; favoring; favorable; helpful."

definition: "To cover or shield from danger or injury; to defend; to guard; to preserve in safety; as  a father protects his children."
simplified_definition: to defend or keep safe; shield from danger or harm.

simplified_definition: protecting or made to protect.

definition: "A body now known as alkali albumin  but originally considered to be the basis of all albuminous substances whence its name."
simplified_definition: a substance that is made up of nitrogen, carbon, oxygen, hydrogen, and possibly other elements. Proteins are found in all living things and are a necessary part of life processes.

definition: "To affirm in a public or formal manner; to bear witness; to declare solemnly; to avow."
simplified_definition: an expression of being against something; objection; complaint.

definition: "One who protests;  originally applied to those who adhered to Luther  and protested against or made a solemn declaration of dissent from a decree of the Emperor Charles V. and the Diet of Spires in  against the Reformers and appealed to a general council;  now used in a popular sense to designate any Christian who does not belong to the Roman Catholic or the Greek Church."
simplified_definition: a Christian who belongs to a church other than the Catholic Church or an Eastern Orthodox church.

definition: "The viscid and more or less granular material of vegetable and animal cells  possessed of vital properties by which the processes of nutrition secretion and growth go forward; the socalled """" physical basis of life;"""" the original cell substance cytoplasm cytoblastema bioplasm sarcode etc."
simplified_definition: a substance that is like a jelly and is a necessary part of plant and animal cells.

definition: "One of the Protozoa."
simplified_definition: a tiny living thing that is similar to an animal but has only one cell or lives as a colony of single cells. Protozoans include amoebas and paramecia.

definition: "To thrust forward; to drive or force along."

definition: "Excited by sexual desire;  applied particularly to the females of some animals."
simplified_definition: feeling pleased, satisfied, and worthy because of something one owns or has done.

definition: "In a proud manner; with lofty airs or mien; haughtily; arrogantly; boastfully."
simplified_definition: with a feeling or display of pride.

simplified_definition: to show to be true or correct.

definition: "Proved."
simplified_definition: a past participle of "prove."

definition: "To write or utter proverbs."
simplified_definition: a short, oftenused saying that expresses something wise or true.

definition: "To appeal. "

definition: "The fore part of a vessel; the bow; the stem; hence  the vessel itself."

definition: "To dress; to prink; used humorously or in contempt."

simplified_definition: a sacred or holy song or poem; hymn.

simplified_definition: a large wild cat with tan or gray fur and no spots. Pumas live in many parts of North and South America. Pumas are carnivorous mammals. They are also called cougars, mountain lions, or panthers.

definition: "To pound."

definition: "To perforate or stamp with an instrument by pressure  or a blow; as to punch a hole; to punch ticket."

definition: "A young dog; a puppy."

definition: "Hence  in figurative uses:  To free from guilt or moral defilement; as to purify the heart."

definition: "A color formed by  or resembling that formed by a combination of the primary colors red and blue."

definition: "A small bag or pouch  the opening of which is made to draw together closely used to carry money in; by extension any receptacle for money carried on the person; a wallet; a pocketbook; a portemonnaie."

definition: "To follow a matter judicially  as a complaining party; to act as a prosecutor."

definition: "The act of following or going after; esp.  a following with haste either for sport or in hostility; chase; prosecution; as the pursuit of game; the pursuit of an enemy."

definition: "The yellowish white opaque creamy matter produced by the process of suppuration. It consists of innumerable white nucleated cells floating in a clear liquid."

definition: "A pustule; a pimple."

definition: "To throw or cast with a pushing motion """"overhand " the hand being raised from the shoulder; a practice in athletics; as to put the shot or weight."
simplified_definition: to move to a particular position or place.

definition: "One who puts or plates."
simplified_definition: to move about or work randomly and without much effort.

definition: "To cement  or stop with putty."

definition: "To work  as at a puzzle; as to puzzle over a problem."
simplified_definition: a toy or problem that is solved by using thought or by rearranging letters, words, numbers, or objects.

definition: "A solid body standing on a triangular  square or polygonal base and terminating in a point at the top; especially a structure or edifice of this shape."
simplified_definition: a solid figure whose sides are triangles that meet at a single point. The base of a pyramid can be any flat shape with straight sides, such as a triangle or square.

definition: "Any species of very large snakes of the genus Python  and allied genera of the family Pythonidae. They are nearly allied to the boas. Called also rock snake."
simplified_definition: a snake that is not poisonous and lives in Africa, Asia, and Australia. Pythons kill by winding around their prey and squeezing it until it can not breathe.

definition: "the seventeenth letter of the English alphabet  has but one sound  and is always followed by u the two letters together being sounded like kw except in some words in which the u is silent. See Guide to Pronunciation  . Q is not found in AngloSaxon cw being used instead of qu; as in cwic quick; cwen queen. The name  is from the French ku which is from the Latin name of the same letter; its form is from the Latin which derived it through a Greek alphabet
simplified_definition: the seventeenth letter of the English alphabet.

definition: "Pertaining to or characterized by  boasting and pretension; used by quacks; pretending to cure diseases; as a quack medicine; a quack doctor."
simplified_definition: the sound that a duck makes.

definition: "Having four sides  and consequently four angles; quadrangular."
simplified_definition: any flat closed figure with four straight sides, such as a square or parallelogram.

definition: "Having four feet."
simplified_definition: an animal with four feet.

definition: "To be multiplied by four; to increase fourfold; to become four times as much."
simplified_definition: multiplied by four.

definition: "Alt. of Quahaug"

definition: "To die; to perish; hence  to wither; to fade."
simplified_definition: a bird related to the chicken that lives on the ground and is often hunted for sport and food.

definition: "Curious and fanciful; affected; odd; whimsical; antique; archaic; singular; unusual; as  quaint architecture; a quaint expression."
simplified_definition: pleasant in an oldfashioned way.

definition: "To be agitated with quick  short motions continually repeated; to shake with fear cold etc.; to shudder; to tremble."

definition: "Any grasshopper or locust of the genus (Edipoda;  so called from the quaking noise made during flight."
simplified_definition: a member of a Christian religious group founded in England about , called the Society of Friends.

definition: "The act of qualifying  or the condition of being qualified."
simplified_definition: something that makes a person fit for an activity or job.

definition: "Fitted by accomplishments or endowments."
simplified_definition: having the qualities or skills that are needed.

definition: "To make such as is required; to give added or requisite qualities to; to fit  as for a place office occupation or character; to furnish with the knowledge skill or other accomplishment necessary for a purpose; to make capable as of an employment or privilege; to supply with legal power or capacity."

definition: "The condition of being of such and such a sort as distinguished from others; nature or character relatively considered  as of goods; character; sort; rank."
simplified_definition: a feature that makes a person or thing what it is.

definition: "A sudden attack of illness  faintness or pain; an agony."
simplified_definition: a feeling of guilt or doubt.

definition: "To modify or qualify with respect to quantity; to fix or express the quantity of; to rate."

definition: "The period of forty days during which the widow had the privilege of remaining in the mansion house of which her husband died seized."

definition: "To find fault; to cavil; as  to quarrel with one's lot."
simplified_definition: an angry argument or disagreement.

definition: "A part of the entrails of the beast taken  given to the hounds."
simplified_definition: a large open hole or pit dug for mining stone, marble, gravel, or the like.

definition: "In cards  four successive cards of the same suit. Cf. Tierce ."
simplified_definition: a unit of measure equal to two pints or a quarter of a gallon. A quart is a little less than a liter.

definition: "A division of a town  city or county; a particular district; a locality; as the Latin quarter in Paris."
simplified_definition: an amount equal to one fourth of a whole.

definition: "Containing  or consisting of a fourth part; as quarterly seasons."

definition: "A long and stout staff formerly used as a weapon of defense and offense;  so called because in holding it one hand was placed in the middle  and the other between the middle and the end."

definition: "Alt. of Quartette"
simplified_definition: four musicians or singers who perform together as a group.

definition: "A form of silica  or silicon dioxide  occurring in hexagonal crystals which are commonly colorless and transparent but sometimes also yellow brown purple green and of other colors; also in cryptocrystalline massive forms varying in color and degree of transparency being sometimes opaque."
simplified_definition: a common, hard mineral that is usually found as glasslike crystals.

definition: "A mole  bank or wharf formed toward the sea or at the side of a harbor river or other navigable water for convenience in loading and unloading vessels."
simplified_definition: a pier, wharf, or other landing place for loading and unloading boats or ships.

definition: "Sick at the stomach; affected with nausea; inclined to vomit; qualmish."

definition: "Same as Hydrophobia ; canine madness."
simplified_definition: a disease that is caused by a virus and can kill people, dogs, and other mammals. Symptoms of rabies are foaming at the mouth and violent or strange behavior. A person can get rabies if scratched or bitten by an animal that has the disease.

definition: "A North American nocturnal carnivore  allied to the bears  but much smaller and having a long full tail banded with black and gray. Its body is gray varied with black and white. Called also coon and mapach."
simplified_definition: a small mammal with brown and gray fur, a long tail with black rings, and a pointed face with black markings that look like a mask. Raccoons eat plants and small animals such as insects and frogs. In towns and cities, they eat garbage. Several kinds of raccoons live in North and South America and on Caribbean islands.

definition: "A progress; a course; a movement or progression."

definition: "To engage in noisy sport; to frolic."

definition: "the nineteenth letter of the English alphabet  is a consonant and is often called a sibilant in allusion to its hissing sound. definition: "Covered or affected with scurf or scabs; scabby; scurfy; specifically  diseased with the scurvy."

definition: "An inland body of water  esp. if large or if salt or brackish; as the Caspian Sea; the Sea of Aral; sometimes a small freshwater lake; as the Sea of Galilee."

definition: "Any gull living on the seacoast."
simplified_definition: a gull that lives on or near the sea.

definition: "The level of the surface of the sea; any surface on the same level with the sea."
simplified_definition: the surface level of the sea, halfway between high and low tide. It is used as the starting point for measuring elevations and depths.

definition: "Any one of several large species of seals of the family Otariidae native of the Pacific Ocean  especially the southern sea lion  of the South American coast; the northern sea lion  found from California to Japan; and the black or California sea lion  which is common on the rocks near San Francisco."
simplified_definition: a mammal that spends most of its life in the ocean. Sea lions are a kind of pinniped, or mammal with flippers instead of feet. Various kinds of sea lions live on the coasts of the Pacific Ocean. Sea lions are carnivores that eat fish and squid. They are closely related to seals and walruses.

definition: "An aquatic carnivore  found in the North Pacific Ocean. Its fur is highly valued especially by the Chinese. It is allied to the common otter but is larger with feet more decidedly webbed."
simplified_definition: a mammal with thick brown fur, a long body, a flat tail, and short legs. Sea otters live mostly in the Pacific Ocean in areas near the coast of California and Alaska.

definition: "Any one of several very large species of chelonians having the feet converted into paddles  as the green turtle hawkbill loggerhead and leatherback. They inhabit all warm seas."
simplified_definition: a large turtle that lives mostly in the sea. Sea turtles have long legs that are wide and flat so that swimming is easy. Sea turtles come onto the land to lay their eggs.

definition: "Any one of numerous species of echinoderms of the order Echinoidea."
simplified_definition: a small sea animal with a soft body inside a hard, round shell. Its shell is covered with long, thin spines. Sea urchins are related to starfish.

definition: "The seashore; seacoast."
simplified_definition: a region along the coast of a body of water.

definition: "The shore or border of the land adjacent to the sea or ocean. Also used adjectively."

definition: "Following the business of a mariner; as  a seafaring man."

definition: "That which confirms  ratifies or makes stable; that which authenticates; that which secures; assurance."

Various kinds of seals live in both warm and cold parts of the world's oceans. A few kinds live in fresh water. Seals are carnivores that eat fish and sea birds. They are closely related to sea lions and walruses.

definition: "Grease; tallow; lard."

definition: "A port on the seashore  or one accessible for seagoing vessels. Also used adjectively; as a seaport town."

definition: "To seek; to look for something; to make inquiry  exploration or examination; to hunt."

definition: "Fig.: The people of God  as being under the government and protection of Christ the great Shepherd."

definition: "Shears See Shear."

definition: "In general  a large broad piece of anything thin as paper cloth etc.; a broad thin portion of any substance; an expanded superficies."

definition: "A hollow projectile  of various shapes adapted for a mortar or a cannon and containing an explosive substance ignited with a fuse or by percussion by means of which the projectile is burst and its fragments scattered. See Bomb."

definition: "See the Note under d Lac."

simplified_definition: a small animal that lives in fresh or salt water and has a shell outside its body. Shellfish are not true fish. They are invertebrates, or animals with no backbone. People can eat many kinds of shellfish, including clams, oysters, shrimp, and lobsters.

definition: "To be a shelter for; to provide with a shelter; to cover from injury or annoyance; to shield; to protect."

definition: "A faint  tremulous light; a gleaming; a glimmer."

definition: "Sunshine; fair weather."

definition: "A sign for an office or a shop; as  to hang out one's shingle."
simplified_definition: a thin, flat piece of wood or other building material. Shingles are attached in overlapping rows to cover the roof or sides of a building.

simplified_definition: a major religion in Japan. People of the Shinto religion worship nature and ancestors.

definition: "Bright; luminous; clear; unclouded."

definition: "To avoid; to escape; to neglect;  implying unfaithfulness or fraud; as  to shirk duty."

definition: "A nonmetalic element analogous to carbon. It always occurs combined in nature  and is artificially obtained in the free state usually as a dark brown amorphous powder or as a dark crystalline substance with a meetallic luster. Its oxide is silica or common quartz and in this form or as silicates it is next to oxygen the most abundant element of the earth's crust. Silicon is characteristically the element of the mineral kingdom as carbon is of the organic world. Symbol Si. Atomic weight . Called also silicium."
simplified_definition: a hard, dark gray substance that is a chemical element. It is found in silica, a compound that makes up one fourth of the earth's crust. Silicon is used in making glass, concrete, bricks, and computer chips.

definition: "Six."

definition: "Wanton; restive; freakish; volatile; changeable; fickle."

definition: "Any one of several species of American musteline carnivores of the genus Mephitis and allied genera. They have two glands near the anus  secreting an extremely fetid liquid which the animal ejects at pleasure as a means of defense."
simplified_definition: a small mammal with black and white fur and a bushy tail. Skunks defend themselves with a spray that smells very bad. They are active at night, when they hunt rodents, insects, and eggs. Several kinds of skunks live in North and South America. They are related to badgers, otters, and other kinds of weasels.

definition: "To throw towards the sky; as  to sky a ball at cricket."

definition: "That which is slimy or viscous; moist earth; mud; also  a puddle."
simplified_definition: a flat, wide, and thick piece of some solid. Rocks and foods can be slabs.

definition: "Alt. of Slacken"
simplified_definition: not tight; hanging loose; drooping.

definition: "The refuse of alum works."

simplified_definition: very informal speech that is made up of new words, or new meanings of old words. Slang is not appropriate for serious conversation or writing.

definition: "of Slide"
simplified_definition: the past tense and past participle of "slide."

definition: "Slightly."

simplified_definition: any small, flat shoe that may be easily put on and taken off. Slippers are indoor shoes.

definition: "Uncertain in effect."

definition: "d. pers. sing. pres. of Slide."

definition: "To slide; to glide."

simplified_definition: a small, thin splinter of wood or glass that has broken off.

definition: "The war cry  or gathering word of a Highland clan in Scotland; hence any rallying cry."

definition: "A vessel having one mast and foreandaft rig  consisting of a boomandgaff mainsail jibs staysail and gaff topsail. The typical sloop has a fixed bowsprit topmast and standing rigging while those of a cutter are capable of being readily shifted. The sloop usually carries a centerboard and depends for stability upon breadth of beam rather than depth of keel. The two types have rapidly approximated since . One radical distinction is that a slop may carry a centerboard. See Cutter and Illustration in Appendix."
simplified_definition: a sailboat that has one mast and sails that reach from one end of the boat to the other.

definition: "Readymade clothes; also  among seamen clothing bedding and other furnishings."

definition: "A substance which dissolves in water  thus forming a lather and is used as a cleansing agent. Saponification. By extension

definition: "Smeared with soap; covered with soap."

definition: "To fly aloft  as a bird; to mount upward on wings or as on wings."

definition: "To soak."

definition: "To become sober;  often with down."

definition: "Forming compound groups or colonies by budding from basal processes or stolons; as  the social ascidians."
simplified_definition: living in groups or communities instead of alone.

definition: "A theory or system of social reform which contemplates a complete reconstruction of society  with a more just and equitable distribution of property and labor. In popular usage the term is often employed to indicate any lawless revolutionary social scheme. See Communism Fourierism SaintSimonianism forms of socialism."
simplified_definition: a theory of government in which the whole community rather than individuals owns all of its property and resources.

definition: "One who advocates or practices the doctrines of socialism."

simplified_definition: an opening into which something fits or is put.

simplified_definition: the layer of ground that contains the grass; turf.

definition: "Sodium oxide or hydroxide."

definition: "A common metallic element of the alkali group  in nature always occuring combined as in common salt in albite etc. It is isolated as a soft waxy white unstable metal so readily oxidized that it combines violently with water and to be preserved must be kept under petroleum or some similar liquid. Sodium is used combined in many salts in the free state as a reducer and as a means of obtaining other metals  is an important commercial product. Symbol Na . Atomic weight . Specific gravity .."
simplified_definition: a soft, silverwhite metal that is a chemical element. It combines easily with other elements and is found in nature only in compounds with other elements. Sodium reacts with chlorine to form the salt we eat in foods.

definition: "A long seat  usually with a cushioned bottom back and ends;  much used as a comfortable piece of furniture."

definition: "Be quiet; hold; stop; not so fast."

definition: "To make less harsh or grating  or of a quality the opposite; as to soften the voice."
simplified_definition: to make or become soft or softer.

definition: "In a soft manner."

definition: "Filled with water; soft with moisture; sodden; soaked; wet; as  soggy land or timber."

definition: "That which soils or pollutes; a soiled place; spot; stain."

definition: "The sun."

definition: "Born under the predominant influence of the sun."

definition: "Single; unmarried; as  a feme sole."

definition: "Singly; alone; only; without another; as  to rest a cause solely one argument; to rely solelyn one's own strength."

definition: "Made in form; ceremonious; as  solemn war; conforming with all legal requirements; as probate in solemn form."
simplified_definition: serious in appearance, sound, or mood.

definition: "A substance that is held in a fixed form by cohesion among its particles; a substance not fluid."
simplified_definition: having a firm shape or form that can be measured in length, width, and height; not like a liquid or a gas.

definition: "A game which one person can play alone;  applied to many games of cards  etc.; also to a game played on a board with pegs or balls in which the object is beginning with all the places filled except one to remove all but one of the pieces by """"jumping " as in draughts."

definition: "Living or being by one's self; having no companion present; being without associates; single; alone; lonely."

definition: "The state of being dissolved or disintegrated; resolution; disintegration."

definition: "A solution; an explanation."

definition: "Alt. of Sombre"
simplified_definition: of a dark shade or condition.

definition: "Considerable in number or quality."
simplified_definition: a suffix that means "to be" or "likely to cause."

definition: "A person unknown or uncertain; a person indeterminate; some person."

definition: "The form or shape given to materials; fashion or shape; form; figure."

definition: "A very large toothed whale   having a head of enormous size. The upper jaw is destitute of teeth. In the upper part of the head above the skull there is a large cavity or case filled with oil and spermaceti. This whale sometimes grows to the length of more than eighty feet. It is found in the warmer parts of all the oceans. Called also cachalot and spermaceti whale."
simplified_definition: a very large mammal that lives in the ocean. Sperm whales dive very deeply and can hold their breath for over an hour. They are related to porpoises, dolphins, and other whales with teeth. Sperm whales are the largest toothed whale.

definition: "To utter a shrill  abrupt scream; to squeak harshly."

definition: "Any one of numerous species of tenarmed cephalopods having a long  tapered body and a caudal fin on each side; especially any species of Loligo Ommastrephes and related genera. See Calamary Decacerata Dibranchiata."

definition: "To twist about briskly with contorions like an eel or a worm; to wriggle; to writhe."

definition: "Any one of numerous species of small rodents belonging to the genus Sciurus and several allied genera of the family Sciuridae. Squirrels generally have a bushy tail  large erect ears and strong hind legs. They are commonly arboreal in their habits but many species live in burrows."

definition: "Hence  to throw out or utter words rapidly; to prate."

definition: "To pierce with a pointed weapon; to wound or kill by the thrust of a pointed instrument; as  to stab a man with a dagger; also to thrust; as to stab a dagger into a person."

definition: "Steady in purpose; constant; firm in resolution; not easily diverted from a purpose; not fickle or wavering; as  a man of stable character."

definition: "To lay in a conical or other pile; to make into a large pile; as  to stack hay cornstalks or grain; to stack or place wood."

definition: "A Greek measure of length  being the chief one used for itinerary distances also adopted by the Romans for nautical and astronomical measurements. It was equal to  Greek or  Roman feet or  Roman paces or to  feet  inches English. This was also called the Olympic stadium as being the exact length of the footrace course at Olympia."
simplified_definition: a place used for sports events and other outdoor activities, which has rows of seats that rise up around an open field.

definition: "The five lines and the spaces on which music is written;  formerly called stave."
simplified_definition: a pole or rod often used as an aid in walking or hiking; walking stick.

definition: "To watch; to dog  or keep track of."

definition: "A degree of advancement in any pursuit  or of progress toward an end or result."

definition: "A coach that runs regularly from one stage  station or place to another for the conveyance of passengers."

simplified_definition: a unit of speech formed with a single pulse of air pressure. Syllables are made of a single vowel sound with or without surrounding consonants.

definition: "Any one of several species of large oddtoed ungulates belonging to Tapirus  Elasmognathus and allied genera. They have a long prehensile upper lip short ears short and stout legs a short thick tail and short close hair. They have three toes on the hind feet and four toes on the fore feet but the outermost toe is of little use."
simplified_definition: a large mammal that has four short legs with hooves, a round body, and a long flexible snout. Tapirs look like pigs, but they are related to horses and rhinoceroses. They live in the rain forests of southeast Asia and Central and South America. Tapirs eat plants.

definition: "A thick  black viscous liquid obtained by the distillation of wood coal etc. and having a varied composition according to the temperature and material employed in obtaining it."
simplified_definition: a dark, heavy, sticky substance made from wood, coal, or peat. Tar is used to cover roads and protect roofs.

simplified_definition: a large, hairy spider found in the warmer parts of North, Central, and South America. Some tarantulas have a slightly poisonous bite.

definition: "Moving with a slow pace or motion; slow; not swift."

simplified_definition: an instrument for measuring temperature. Some thermometers are made of a closed glass tube containing mercury or alcohol that rises or falls as the temperature rises or falls.

definition: "A selfacting apparatus for regulating temperature by the unequal expansion of different metals  liquids or gases by heat as in opening or closing the damper of a stove or the like as the heat becomes greater or less than is desired."
simplified_definition: a device that controls temperature automatically. Thermostats may be found in houses, cars, ovens, and refrigerators.

definition: "A treasury or storehouse; hence  a repository especially of knowledge;  often applied to a comprehensive work like a dictionary or cyclopedia."
simplified_definition: a book that lists words with their synonyms or antonyms.

definition: "of This"
simplified_definition: plural of "this."

definition: "The plural of he  she or it. They is never used adjectively but always as a pronoun proper and sometimes refers to persons without an antecedent expressed."
simplified_definition: those people, animals, or things being pointed to.

definition: "To a great depth  or to a greater depth than usual; as land covered thick with manure."
simplified_definition: large in measurement from one side of a surface to the opposite side; not thin in the smallest dimension of something.

definition: "To make more frequent; as  to thicken blows."
simplified_definition: to make or become thick or thicker.

definition: "A wood or a collection of trees  shrubs etc. closely set; as a ram caught in a thicket."
simplified_definition: a thick patch of shrubs, bushes, or small trees.

definition: "The quality or state of being thick ."
simplified_definition: the fact or quality of being thick.

definition: "One who steals; one who commits theft or larceny. See Theft."
simplified_definition: someone who steals.

definition: "The coxa  or femur of an insect."
simplified_definition: the part of the human leg between the hip and the knee.

definition: "A kind of cap or cover  or sometimes a broad ring for the end of the finger used in sewing to protect the finger when pushing the needle through the material. It is usually made of metal and has upon the outer surface numerous small pits to catch the head of the needle."
simplified_definition: a small cup worn to protect the finger that pushes the needle through cloth when sewing. A thimble is usually made of a hard material such as metal or plastic.

definition: "Not thickly or closely; in a seattered state; as  seed sown thin."
simplified_definition: small in the measure from one side of a surface to the other; not thick.

definition: "A portion or part; something."
simplified_definition: that which is spoken of, thought of, or done.

definition: "To believe; to consider; to esteem."
simplified_definition: to use the power of the mind.

definition: "The sixtieth part of a second of time."
simplified_definition: coming next after the second in a series.

definition: "A sensation of dryness in the throat associated with a craving for liquids  produced by deprivation of drink or by some other cause  which arrests the secretion of the pharyngeal mucous membrane; hence the condition producing this sensation."
simplified_definition: a dry feeling in the mouth or throat that is caused by the need or desire to drink.

definition: "Deficient in moisture; dry; parched."
simplified_definition: feeling a need to drink.

definition: "One more than twelve; ten and three; as  thirteen ounces or pounds."
simplified_definition: the number that comes after  and before  in the sequence of cardinal numbers; .

definition: "The interval comprising an octave and a sixth."
simplified_definition: coming next after the twelfth in a series.

definition: "Constituting or being one of thirty equal parts into which anything is divided."
simplified_definition: coming next after the twentyninth in a series.

definition: "Being three times ten; consisting of one more than twentynine; twenty and ten; as  the month of June consists of thirty days."
simplified_definition: the number that is equal to three times ten; .

definition: "As an adjective  this has the same demonstrative force as the pronoun but is followed by a noun; as this book; this way to town."
simplified_definition: the person, thing, or matter that is mentioned, understood, or present.

definition: "Any one of several prickly composite plants  especially those of the genera Cnicus Craduus and Onopordon. The name is often also applied to other prickly plants."
simplified_definition: a kind of plant with prickly leaves and a head of purple flowers.

definition: "A strap of leather; especially  one used for fastening anything."
simplified_definition: a narrow strip of leather or similar material that is used to tie or fasten.

definition: "The part of the trunk between the neck and the abdomen  containing that part of the body cavity the walls of which are supported by the dorsal vertebrae the ribs and the sternum and which the heart and lungs are situated; the chest."
simplified_definition: the part of the body between the neck and the abdomen in humans and in animals with four limbs; chest. It contains the ribs, heart, and lungs.

definition: "Fig.: That which pricks or annoys as a thorn; anything troublesome; trouble; care."
simplified_definition: a short, stiff point on a plant stem or branch.

definition: "Passing through or to the end; hence  complete; perfect; as a thorough reformation; thorough work; a thorough translator; a thorough poet."
simplified_definition: leaving nothing out; complete.

definition: "Bred from the best blood through a long line; pureblooded;  said of stock  as horses. Hence having the characteristics of such breeding; mettlesome; courageous; of elegant form or the like."
simplified_definition: of a pure breed.

definition: "A passage through; a passage from one street or opening to another; an unobstructed way open to the public; a public road; hence  a frequented street."
simplified_definition: a street that opens at both ends into other streets.

definition: "The plural of that. See That."
simplified_definition: plural of "that."

definition: "The second personal pronoun  in the singular number denoting the person addressed; thyself; the pronoun which is used in addressing persons in the solemn or poetical style."
simplified_definition: you; the person or god spoken to. This word was once in common use, but is now used mostly in literature of the past and religious texts.

definition: "Granting  admitting or supposing that; notwithstanding that; if."
simplified_definition: in spite of the fact that.

definition: "of Think"
simplified_definition: the act, process, or power of thinking.

definition: "Anxious; solicitous; concerned."
simplified_definition: having or showing careful thought.

definition: "Lacking thought; careless; inconsiderate; rash; as  a thoughtless person or act."
simplified_definition: not thinking enough; showing little care.

definition: "The number of ten hundred; a collection or sum consisting of ten times one hundred units or objects."
simplified_definition: the word for the the Arabic numeral  and the Roman numeral M.

definition: "Alt. of Thresh"
simplified_definition: to give a beating to; whip.

definition: "To pass a thread through the eye of; as  to thread a needle."
simplified_definition: a fine cord used in sewing, weaving, and the like. Thread is usually made of two or more fibers such as cotton twisted together.

definition: "The expression of an intention to inflict evil or injury on another; the declaration of an evil  loss or pain to come; menace; threatening; denunciation."
simplified_definition: a statement that harm or punishment will follow.

definition: "To use threats  or menaces; also to have a threatening appearance."
simplified_definition: to say that one will harm or punish; make a threat to.

definition: "of Threaten"
simplified_definition: having an uncertain chance of surviving into the future.

definition: "One more than two; two and one."
simplified_definition: the word for the Arabic numeral  and the Roman numeral III.

definition: "To practice thrashing grain or the like; to perform the business of beating grain from straw; as  a man who thrashes well."
simplified_definition: to separate the grain or seeds from.

definition: "The plank  stone or piece of timber which lies under a door especially of a dwelling house church temple or the like; the doorsill; hence entrance; gate; door."
simplified_definition: the piece of wood or stone underneath a door that forms the bottom of the doorway.

definition: "of Throw"
simplified_definition: the past tense of "throw."

definition: "One of several species of flowering plants of the genera Statice and Armeria."
simplified_definition: wise use and saving of money or other resources.

definition: "A sensation as of being thrilled; a tremulous excitement; as  a thrill of horror; a thrill of joy."
simplified_definition: to cause to feel a sudden, sharp excitement.

definition: "To prosper by industry  economy and good management of property; to increase in goods and estate; as a farmer thrives by good husbandry."
simplified_definition: to do well or be successful.

definition: "That end of a gaff which is next the mast."
simplified_definition: the narrow passage inside the neck. Food and air pass through the throat to the stomach and lungs.

definition: "To beat  or pulsate with more than usual force or rapidity; to beat in consequence of agitation; to palpitate;  said of the heart pulse etc."
simplified_definition: to beat or pulse quickly and strongly.

definition: "To be in  or sit upon a throne; to be placed as if upon a throne."
simplified_definition: the seat used by a ruler or other important person for ceremonies or other special events.

definition: "of Thring"
simplified_definition: a large crowd of people.

definition: "To the end; to a conclusion; to the ultimate purpose; as  to carry a project through."
simplified_definition: in one side or end and out the other.

definition: "Quite through; from one extremity to the other of; also  every part of; as to search throughout the house."
simplified_definition: in, to, or during every part of.

definition: "A cast of dice; the manner in which dice fall when cast; as  a good throw."
simplified_definition: to send through the air with force by using the arm and wrist; hurl.

definition: "a.  p. p. from Throw  v."
simplified_definition: past participle of "throw."

definition: "An affection of the mouth  fauces etc. common in newly born children characterized by minute ulcers called aphthae. See Aphthae."
simplified_definition: a common songbird that can be found in many parts of the world. Many thrushes have a dark upper body and a spotted breast. The robin and bluebird are kinds of thrushes.

definition: "The breaking down of the roof of a gallery under its superincumbent weight."
simplified_definition: to push or drive with force.

definition: "A dull sound without resonance  like that produced by striking with or striking against some comparatively soft substance; also the stroke or blow producing such sound; as the thrud of a cannon ball striking the earth."
simplified_definition: a dull, muffled sound of one thing hitting another.

definition: "One of an association of robbers and murderers in India who practiced murder by stealthy approaches  and from religious motives. They have been nearly exterminated by the British government."
simplified_definition: a criminal who is rough or uses violence.

definition: "To play with the thumb or thumbs; to play clumsily; to thrum."
simplified_definition: the short, thick first finger on humans and other primates. The thumb makes it easy for the hand to pick up things and grasp them.

definition: "To strike or beat with something thick or heavy  or so as to cause a dull sound."
simplified_definition: a heavy, dull sound of one thing hitting another.

definition: "To emit with noise and terror; to utter vehemently; to publish  as a threat or denunciation."
simplified_definition: the loud cracking noise or low distant rumble that follows a flash of lightning. Thunder is caused by the violent movement of air masses.

definition: "A cloud charged with electricity  and producing lightning and thunder."
simplified_definition: a large, dark storm cloud that makes lightning and thunder. Thunderclouds are charged with electricity.

definition: "A storm accompanied with lightning and thunder."
simplified_definition: a storm with thunder, lightning, rain, and wind.

definition: "The fifth day of the week  following Wednesday and preceding Friday."
simplified_definition: the fifth day of the week. Thursday comes between Wednesday and Friday.

definition: "To this degree or extent; so far; so; as  thus wise; thus peaceble; thus bold."
simplified_definition: in this way; so.

definition: "Of thee  or belonging to thee; the more common form of thine possessive case of thou;  used always attributively and chiefly in the solemn or grave style and in poetry. Thine is used in the predicate; as the knife is thine. See Thine."
simplified_definition: your. This word is used mostly in religion and in things written long ago.

definition: "Any plant of the labiate genus Thymus. The garden thyme  is a warm  pungent aromatic much used to give a relish to seasoning and soups."
simplified_definition: a small plant that has fragrant leaves and is related to the mint plant. Thyme is an herb.

definition: "To check off by means of a tick or any small mark; to score."
simplified_definition: the quiet, clicking sound of a watch or clock.

definition: "To furnish with a tickets; to book; as  to ticket passengers to California."
simplified_definition: a small, narrow slip of paper or thin cardboard that shows that one has paid for something.

definition: "Wavering  or liable to waver and fall at the slightest touch; unstable; easily overthrown."
simplified_definition: to touch or poke so as to cause a tingling feeling or laughter.

definition: "Difficult; nice; critical; as  a ticklish business."
simplified_definition: sensitive to tickling.

definition: "Of or pertaining to tides; caused by tides; having tides; periodically rising and falling  or following and ebbing; as tidal waters."
simplified_definition: caused by, having, or related to tides.

definition: "The alternate rising and falling of the waters of the ocean  and of bays rivers etc. connected therewith. The tide ebbs and flows twice in each lunar day or the space of a little more than twentyfour hours. It is occasioned by the attraction of the sun and moon  acting unequally on the waters in different parts of the earth thus disturbing their equilibrium. A high tide upon one side of the earth is accompanied by a high tide upon the opposite side. Hence when the sun and moon are in conjunction or opposition as at new moon and full moon their action is such as to produce a greater than the usual tide called the spring tide
simplified_definition: the change in the height of the surface of oceans and other large bodies of water that happens about every twelve hours. Tides are caused by the pull of the moon and sun.

definition: "Account of what has taken place  and was not before known; news."
simplified_definition: news or information.

definition: "To make things tidy."
simplified_definition: neat and in order.

definition: "A line  usually straight drawn across the stems of notes or a curved line written over or under the notes signifying that they are to be slurred or closely united in the performance or that two notes of the same pitch are to be sounded as one; a bind; a ligature."
simplified_definition: to fasten, secure, or bind with a cord or string.

definition: "A chold's apron covering the upper part of the body  and tied with tape or cord; a pinafore."
simplified_definition: one of several rows or layers placed one above another.

definition: "A very large and powerful carnivore  native of Southern Asia and the East Indies. Its back and sides are tawny or rufous yellow  transversely striped with black the tail is ringed with black the throat and belly are nearly white. When full grown it equals or exceeds the lion in size and strength. Called also royal tiger and Bengal tiger."
simplified_definition: a large, very strong mammal with short, yelloworange fur and black stripes. Tigers are carnivores. They live in several parts of Asia but are endangered in all their habitats. Tigers are the largest of the big cats and are closely related to lions, leopards, and other cats that roar.

definition: "Fitting close  or too close to the body; as a tight coat or other garment."
simplified_definition: fastened or shut in a secure way; fixed in place.

definition: "To draw tighter; to straiten; to make more close in any manner."
simplified_definition: to make or become tight.

definition: "Closefitting garments  especially for the lower part of the body and the legs."
simplified_definition: a piece of clothing made of tight, stretchy material that covers the legs and hips. Tights are worn for exercise, dancing, or as everyday clothing under a skirt.

definition: "A stiff hat."
simplified_definition: a flat piece of baked clay or other hard material. Tiles are used to cover floors, walls, or roofs.

definition: "To cultivate land."
simplified_definition: to prepare for growing crops, especially by plowing.

definition: "A small drawer; a till."
simplified_definition: a handle that is attached to a rudder and used to steer a boat.

definition: "A covering overhead; especially  a tent."
simplified_definition: to move or place so that one side is higher than the other; tip.

definition: "Fig.: Material for any structure."
simplified_definition: trees that are used as wood to build houses and buildings.

definition: "To pass time; to delay."
simplified_definition: the system in which events appear to happen one after the next in a way that can never be turned back; the past, present, and future.

definition: "Keeping time or measure."
simplified_definition: happening at just the right moment.

definition: "A timekeeper; especially  a watch by which small intervals of time can be measured; a kind of stop watch. It is used for timing the speed of horses machinery etc."
simplified_definition: one who measures or records time.

definition: "of Time"
simplified_definition: multiplied by.

definition: "A table showing the notation  length or duration of the several notes."
simplified_definition: a schedule that lists the times at which certain events take place. People read timetables to find out when trains, buses, or airplanes will arrive or leave.

definition: "Wanting courage to meet danger; easily frightened; timorous; not bold; fearful; shy."
simplified_definition: not bold or confident with other people; shy.

definition: "of Time"
simplified_definition: the act, art, or method of adjusting the pace of actions to create the most powerful or useful effect.

definition: "Thin plates of iron covered with tin; tin plate."
simplified_definition: a soft, light gray metal that is one of the chemical elements. Tin does not rust easily. It can be combined with other metals to form alloys such as bronze or pewter.

definition: "To imbue or impregnate with something different or foreign; as  to tinge a decoction with a bitter taste; to affect in some degree with the qualities of another substance either by mixture or by application to the surface; especially to color slightly; to stain; as to tinge a blue color with red; an infusion tinged with a yellow color by saffron."
simplified_definition: to give a slight color to.

definition: "To feel a sharp  thrilling pain."
simplified_definition: to have a light stinging or prickly feeling.

definition: "To make  or give forth small quick sharp sounds as a piece of metal does when struck; to clink."
simplified_definition: to make light ringing sounds.

definition: "To adorn with tinsel; to deck out with cheap but showy ornaments; to make gaudy."
simplified_definition: strips or sheets of foil or other shiny material used as a decoration.

definition: "To give a slight coloring to; to tinge."
simplified_definition: a shade of a color.

definition: "Very small; little; puny."
simplified_definition: very small, minute; miniature.

definition: "A thin  boarded brush made of camel's hair used by gilders in lifting gold leaf."
simplified_definition: to move to a leaning or slanted position; tilt.

definition: "To step or walk on tiptoe."

definition: "Weary; fatigued; exhausted."
simplified_definition: needing sleep or rest.

simplified_definition: causing a loss of strength or energy.

definition: "A fine transparent silk stuff  used for veils etc.; specifically cloth interwoven with gold or silver threads or embossed with figures."
simplified_definition: a group of cells in an animal or plant body that are like each other and do similar things.

definition: "A church to which a priest was ordained  and where he was to reside."
